Title: Prosjektleder

Vi sker n en prosjektleder som kan styrke vrt team og bidra til  levere gode lsninger for store offentlige byggeprosjekter. Med en rekke spennende oppdrag i horisonten, trenger vi deg som kan se helhetsbildet og samarbeide tett med vre kunder for  sikre at vre leveranser ikke bare mter, men overgr forventningene.
Hos oss vil du vre en integrert del av byggherrens organisasjon, og du vil spille en nkkelrolle i  sikre at vre ambisise ml.Vi i Advansia endrer samfunn! Det er sammensetningen og laget vrt som gjr oss til en sterk samfunnsaktr. Gjennom vre tjenester skal vi skape samfunn som gir vekst for bedrifter og organisasjoner, og goder for innbyggerne. Sammen med kundene vre skaper vi brekraftige lsninger og et bedre samfunn for fremtiden.Vi i Advansia skal bidra til at Norge fr til mer for mindre. Vre bunnsolide metoder og vr sterke kultur skal srge for at Advansia forblir en foretrukken samarbeidspartner. Hele tiden med kundens ml i fokus!  N inviterer vi deg til  bli en del av dette viktige laget!Hyere utdannelse innen bygg eller tekniske fag.Min 10-15 rs erfaring fra relevante formlsprosjekter.Erfaring som prosjektleder hos byggherre eller entreprenr.Erfaring med kontraktsoppflging, risikostyring og fremdriftsplanlegging/styring og bruk av fremdriftsplanverkty.Erfaring med oppflging av prosjektsikkerheten og ha det overordende ansvar for HMS-arbeidet p prosjektet.Fordel med erfaring fra prosjekter som er underlagt sikkerhetsloven. Fordel med erfaring fra forsvars- eller justissektoren og tilhrende EBA/infrastruktur.Kunnskap om byggherreforskriften  God digital kunnskap (fordelaktig med MS Azure Devops, MS-project, Omega 365, Dalux ol).Du har gjerne kjennskap til graderte oppdrag, og du m vre, eller kunne bli sikkerhetsklarert da noen av oppdragene vre krever sikkerhetsklarering. Dette innebrer ogs at du kan mtte g gjennom en sikkerhetssjekk fr du starter hos oss.Som person er du tillitsvekkende og trygg i mte med mennesker og har hy grad av personlig integritet og mot. Vi er stolte av jobben vi gjr og opptatt av  levere kvalitet i vre leveranser. Vi har et godt og inkluderende arbeidsmilj med faglig dyktige og engasjerte kolleger. Hos oss kan du vre deg selv! Title: Analyst, Energy, AFRY Management Consulting
RoleDescription: We are looking for Analysts with 0-2 years of professional experience who are enthusiastic and passionate about the energy transition. As a new colleague you will join our dynamic team of energy market consultants in our recently established Dutch office in Rotterdam (central). Within your induction phase you will also get the chance to visit our UK offices to meet the colleagues, who support the Dutch energy market.Your responsibilities:In your daily tasks as an Analyst, you will: Undertake complex analysis and solve problems with high level competency and accuracy, looking for insights, so what s, key messages and conclusions. Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act. Actively interface with clients and ensure that you and your project team understand the client needs and deliver according to deadline(s), quality standards and client expectations. Communicate complex messages, structure your presentations and communication material in a way that maximises the impact of information and ideas towards our clients. Contribute ideas and develop your innovative thinking applying to business development and project delivery. We expect you to have completed an advanced graduate degree (MSc, MBA, PhD) in (Business) Economics, Econometrics, Engineering or Mathematics - smart people from other degree programs are highly welcome as well. This position is open to graduates and experienced professionals with max. 2 years of working experience, preferably in market analysis & modelling, energy consulting, transactions advisory (due diligences) or the energy industry. We undertake a lot of complex analysis, a good proportion of which is numerical, that is why we expect you to have an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis and the ability to pay attention to detail and preferably use MS Excel proficiently. Proficiency in R/Python/SQL is advantageous. You have a very good command of English and preferably Dutch as well, other languages are advantageous. You love to work collaboratively in a smaller and growing team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of our organization. A pro-active attitude to supporting a social environment (e.g. social drinks, informal events etc.) in which the team will thrive, is valued. You are willing to work at our growing office in Rotterdam at least 2 to 3 days/week. You will be working in a commercial environment against budgets and deadlines so you will need to be able to think for yourself, be pro-active and have a commercially oriented mindset. You are eligible to work in the Netherlands.Our offer: A culture where we live our company values: brave, devoted, team player. Plenty of opportunities to grow and learn everything about Management Consulting and the energy market powered by AFRYs extraordinary global network. Learning and development through qualified consulting trainings and guidance along our career path, accompanied by an experienced mentor. Competitive, performance-oriented compensation with a bonus opportunity of up to 10% of your base pay. 25 vacation days per year with an additional 5 days of compensatory leave, and a possibility to buy 5 extra vacation days per year in consultation. NS Business Card (first class) for commuting and business trips. Various forms of flexibility to help you integrate your daily life with your professional obligations; we offer a hybrid work model, with 2 to 3 days in our office in Rotterdam and 2 to 3 days remote, to support a balanced work-life experience.The application process:As part of your application process, please provide a CV and covering letter (in English) stating why you want to work for AFRY, your salary expectations and an earliest possible start date. We only accept online applications.If we think you could be a good fit for the organisation you will be invited for an initial interview via Microsoft Teams by our HR Team. To allow us to assess your skills in practice you will be asked to present a case study to the UK office. Finally, we are happy to invite you for a final conversation with the Senior Principal, MCD Energy Netherlands in our brand-new office location in central Rotterdam.  At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. Thats how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.

Title: Consultant/Senior Consultant - Energy, AFRY Management Consulting
RoleDescription: We are looking for Consultants/Senior Consultants with 2-4 years of professional experience who are enthusiastic and passionate about the energy transition. As a new colleague you will join our dynamic team of energy market consultants in our recently established Dutch office in Rotterdam (central). Within your induction phase you will also get the chance to visit our UK offices to meet the colleagues, who support the Dutch energy market.Your responsibilities:In your daily tasks as a Consultant/Senior Consultant, you will: Undertake complex analysis and solve problems with high level competency and accuracy, looking for insights, so what s, key messages, and conclusions. Be a role model and support our professional growth by coaching and supporting our Analysts. Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act. Actively interface with clients and ensure that you and your project team understand the client needs and deliver according to deadline(s), quality standards and client expectations Communicate complex messages, structure your presentations and communication material in a way that maximises the impact of information and ideas towards our clients. Contribute ideas and develop your innovative thinking applying to project delivery. We expect you to have completed an advanced graduate degree (MSc, MBA, PhD) in (Business) Economics, Econometrics, Engineering or Mathematics - smart people from other degree programs are highly welcome as well. You have at least 2-4 years of working experience, preferably in market analysis & modelling, energy consulting, transactions advisory (due diligences) or the energy industry. We undertake a lot of complex analysis, a good proportion of which is numerical, that is why we expect you to have an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis and the ability to pay attention to detail and preferably use MS Excel proficiently. Proficiency in R/Python/SQL is advantageous. You have a very good command of English and preferably Dutch as well, other languages are advantageous. You love to work collaboratively in a smaller and growing team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of our organization. A pro-active attitude to supporting a social environment (e.g., social drinks, informal events etc.) in which the team will thrive, is valued. You are willing to work at our growing office in Rotterdam at least 2 to 3 days/week. You will be working in a commercial environment against budgets and deadlines so you will need to be able to think for yourself, be pro-active and have a commercially oriented mindset. You are eligible to work in the Netherlands.Our offer: A culture where we live our company values: brave, devoted, team player. Plenty of opportunities to grow and learn everything about Management Consulting and the energy market powered by AFRYs extraordinary global network. Learning and development through qualified consulting trainings and guidance along our career path, accompanied by an experienced mentor. Competitive, performance-oriented compensation with a bonus opportunity of up to 15% (Consultant) to 20% (Senior Consultant) of your base pay. 25 vacation days per year with an additional 5 days of compensatory leave, and a possibility to buy 5 extra vacation days per year in consultation. NS Business Card (first class) for commuting and business trips. Various forms of flexibility to help you integrate your daily life with your professional obligations; we offer a hybrid work model, with 2 to 3 days in our office in Rotterdam and 2 to 3 days remote, to support a balanced work-life experience.Application process:As part of your application process, please provide a CV and covering letter (in English) stating why you would like to work for AFRY, your salary expectations and an earliest possible start date. We only accept online applications.If we think you could be a good fit for the organisation you will be invited for an initial interview via Microsoft Teams by our HR Team. If we are both happy to continue the process, you will then be invited to present a case study to the UK Office. Finally, if successful, you will be invited for a final interview with the Senior Principal, MCD Energy in our brand-new office location in central Rotterdam.  We look forward to receiving your application!At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. Thats how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.

Title: Senior Transmission Power Systems Engineer
RoleDescription:
Our T&D Power Systems team assists clients in achieving compliance and efficiency by conducting power systems studies to navigate the design, grid connection and access standards for their energy generation and transmission projects. You will become part of a global, tight-knit team of power systems engineers engaged in diverse projects supporting multiple type of international interconnection and grid connection projects (including solar, wind, hydro, battery energy storage, and HVDC interconnectors).
Our team also provides technical assistance to Transmission Grid Operators (TSOs) and utilities, helping the private sector secure crucial grid investments through expert technical support. This role office a unique opportunity to develop your career and play a pivotal role in expanding and shaping our business across Asia for a multinational company, while supporting clients not only in Asia but also in Australia, Europe, and Africa.Regular working days: Mon-Fri., 8 hours/day, 5 days/week
Responsibility:Conduct advanced power system studies (steady-state load flow, short-circuit, and dynamic stability analyses) for generation grid connection projects and transmission planning studies (feasibility and design stages). Projects will be primarily across Asia-Pacific, but also in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Australia. Perform detailed power system modeling and simulations for grid integration of converter-based resources, including high-voltage direct current (HVDC) systems, renewable energy plants (solar and wind), and battery energy storage systems. Analyze their impact on the transmission network, focusing on feasibility studies and compliance with grid requirements.Prepare comprehensive technical study reports for a range of clients (energy project developers, utilities, TSOs), from high-level grid connection feasibility studies to in-depth static and dynamic study reports. Ensure findings are clearly communicated and meet the relevant standards and client expectations. Conduct complex assessments and provide specialist solutions on power system issues. This may include performing generator or converter model validations, stability improvement strategies, and proposing mitigation measures for network constraints. You will also deliver technical presentations and training to internal teams and external clients, sharing knowledge on topics such as HVDC integration, grid stability, and emerging technologies (e.g. HVDC links, STATCOMs, and grid-forming inverter technologies).Contribute to project execution by leading or coordinating complex study tasks, especially those involving converter-based resources. Deliver high-quality outputs within agreed formats and timelines. As a senior engineer, review and validate the work of junior engineers when necessary, providing mentorship and technical guidance to uphold quality and accuracy. Engage in continuous professional development and industry activities. This includes attending or presenting at conferences, participating in industry forums, and staying up to date with the latest developments in power system simulation tools and grid integration technologies to continually enhance our service offerings.Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering (Power Systems or related field).At least 8 years of relevant experience in power system modeling and analysis for grid connections and transmission projects.
